statement.tex: \text{Find the integral of the function}\\ \sin 4 x \cdot \sin 8 x \,

step.context: \text{The following substitution would convert}\\ f(x) = \sin 4 x \cdot \sin 8 x \text{ to the more easily integrable}\\ \text{form } \sin \theta_1 + \sin \theta_2 \text{ or }\cos \theta_1 + \cos \theta_2
step.reason: \sin 4 x \cdot \sin 8 x = \dfrac{1}{2}[\cos 4 x - \cos 12 x] \\ \therefore \int \sin 4 x \cdot \sin 8 x \, dx = \int \dfrac{1}{2}[\cos 4 x - \cos 12 x] dx

step.context: \text{Is the following evaluation of the integral}\\ I = \int \dfrac{1}{2}[\cos 4 x - \cos 12 x] dx \quad \text{correct}?
step.reason: \int \cos (a x)dx = \dfrac{\sin (a x)}{a}+ C_1 \\ \text{where }C_1 \text{ is the constant of integration.}
